articles.title: RBI Bulletin: India's 'output gap' now positive, stagflation risk at only 3% - Moneycontrol
articles.description: The output gap is the difference between an economy's actual output and what it can potentially produce. When the gap is positive, it can lead to demand-pull inflationary pressures
articles.content: India's output gap finally became positive in the first quarter of 2023, an article in the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) monthly bulletin has said. The article, titled State of the Economy, includes … [+3250 chars]
